message:
Hey guys, A friend of mine is new the whole web thingy, she was stuck at the MVC "She's doing asp.net if it may help".
She was shocked a bit and felt like she was missing a lot.

Can someone help me to give her resources to make it easier to understand for her ?Anything is appreciated 

PS: "Yeah I know a lot of people including me hates asp.net but be cool".

data.message: Is she still learning C#? Or she already knew it and just need a small kick toward asp.net?

LOL! knowing how to code is a skill, knowing how to programe in a specific lang is just some rules to learn... So they are diff.
Anyways, I will send a book.
The official ASP MVC website is more than enough as a learning resource. Trust me. Even if she doesn't know C#, common sense alone will get her through it just fine.

this course was enough for me to get basic things done with ASP.NET MVC 5 : http://www.pluralsight.com/courses/aspdotnet-mvc5-fundamentals
but i really recommend watching the same course about version 4 first : http://www.pluralsight.com/courses/mvc4 , this will start talking about the MVC pattern from scratch, then start building a simple CMS by examples. BTW Scott Allen is my HERO regarding .NET stuff , you will find a lot of interesting things on his other courses and the articles on his blog. http://odetocode.com/

https://www.youtube.com/user/kudvenkat/playlists
this is a good channel to start with
